alert.note: Alert for Arco, Mud Lake Desert; Blackfoot Mountains; Eastern Magic Valley; Franklin, Eastern Oneida Region; Lower Snake River Plain; Marsh and Arbon Highlands; Raft River Region; Shoshone, Lava Beds; Southern Hills, Albion Mountains; Upper Snake River Plain (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued January 08 at 5:41PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...A BAND OF SHOWERS EXTENDING FROM ALBION NORTH THROUGH THE MINIDOKA AREA WILL SHIFT EAST INTO THE INTERSTATE 15 CORRIDOR THROUGH 630 PM MDT-.. At 535 PM MST, an area of rain was located along a line extending from 11 miles southwest of Atomic City to 8 miles northwest of American Falls to 6 miles east of Albion, moving east at 45 mph. Light to moderate rain along with wind gusts of 40 to 45 mph were observed along this line. As the line progresses further east, it will move into a region of colder temperatures, particularly north of American Falls Reservoir. A wintry mix of rain and snow is possible as it reaches the Interstate 15 corridor between 600 and 630 PM MDT as well as isolated areas of freezing rain in the region with colder temperatures north of American Falls. If you are traveling through southeast Idaho early this evening, be prepared for winter driving conditions and be ready to slow down if necessary. Locations impacted include... Southern Idaho Falls, Pocatello, Blackfoot, Burley, Rupert, American Falls, Heyburn, McCammon, Malta, Lake Walcott, Neeley, Chesterfield Reservoir, Goshen, American Falls Reservoir, Chubbuck, Ammon, Shelley, Aberdeen, Paul and Inkom.
